title: Champions and finalists of UEFA EURO championship 1960 to 2016
summary: This grouped bar chart shows Number of titles/final appearances on the Y-axis for 13 different Countrys for 2 groups Winner, and Runner-up that are presented on the X-axis.
For Country Spain, Winner had the highest Number of titles/final appearances 3.0 among the 2 groups and in Yugoslavia, Winner had the lowest Number of titles/final appearances 0.0.
Country USSR and Czechoslovakia had the biggest gap of 3.0 between the highest and lowest Number of titles/final appearances found for Runner-up.
Averaging all 2 groups Winner, and Runner-up, the Country Germany is the maximum Number of titles/final appearances and Czechoslovakia is the minimum Number of titles/final appearances.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Number of titles/final appearances on the Y-axis for 13 different Countrys for 2 groups Winner, and Runner-up that are presented on the X-axis.
Out of all 2 groups, Winner had the highest Number of titles/final appearances for Country Spain and Winner had the lowest Number of titles/final appearances for Country Yugoslavia.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Number of titles/final appearances on the Y-axis for 13 different Countrys for 2 groups Winner, and Runner-up that are presented on the X-axis.
For Country Spain, Winner had the highest Number of titles/final appearances 3.0 among the 2 groups and in Yugoslavia, Winner had the lowest Number of titles/final appearances 0.0.
Country USSR and Czechoslovakia had the biggest gap of 3.0 between the highest and lowest Number of titles/final appearances found for Runner-up.
Averaging all 2 groups Winner, and Runner-up, the Country Germany is the maximum Number of titles/final appearances and Czechoslovakia is the minimum Number of titles/final appearances.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Number of titles/final appearances on the Y-axis for 13 different Countrys for 2 groups Winner, and Runner-up that are presented on the X-axis.
Out of all 2 groups, Winner had the highest Number of titles/final appearances for Country Spain and Winner had the lowest Number of titles/final appearances for Country Yugoslavia.
Among all the Countrys, Runner-up had the highest Number of titles/final appearances in Country USSR and lowest Number of titles/final appearances in Country Czechoslovakia.
Country USSR and Czechoslovakia had the biggest gap of 3.0 between the highest and lowest Number of titles/final appearances found for Runner-up.
Out of all 2 groups, the highest gap between the maximum and minimum Number of titles/final appearances was found in case of Winner.
Averaging all 2 groups Winner, and Runner-up, the Country Germany is the maximum Number of titles/final appearances and Czechoslovakia is the minimum Number of titles/final appearances.
